required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-term Management of Patients Surgically Treated for Chronic Pelvic Pain by Minimally Invasive Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Long-term Management of Patients With Benign Gynecological Pathology and Chronic Pelvic Pain and Follow-up After Minimally Invasive Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: It is a retrospective observational study based on the analysis of the medical records of patients treated for chronic pelvic pain and benign gynecological pathologies at the Gynecology Unit of the University Hospital of Modena from 2010 to 2019. The aim of the study is to analyze the effects of medical and surgical treatments on chronic pelvic pain and associated pathologies.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Pain Scores on the Numeric Rating Scale at 6 months after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Change From Baseline in Pain Scores on the Numeric Rating Scale at 6 months after surgery

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Pain Scores on the Numeric Rating Scale at 6 months after Osteopathic manipulative treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 6 months after Osteopathic manipulative treatment
primary_outcome.description: Change From Baseline in Pain Scores on the Numeric Rating Scale at 6 months after Osteopathic manipulative treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in constipation on the constipation score system (CSS) by Agachan-Wexner at 6 months after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Change From Baseline in constipation on the constipation score system (CSS) by Agachan-Wexner at 6 months after surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of postoperative complications using Clavien-Dindo classification
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis of postoperative (1 month after surgery) complications using Clavien-Dindo classification

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of endometriosis among patients with chronic pelvic pain
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence of endometriosis among patients with chronic pelvic pain

arm_group.description: Patients with chronic pelvic pain and a benign gynecologic disease associated, referring to our Unit, medically or surgically treated from 2010 to 2019

intervention.description: Minimally Invasive Surgery for gynecologic disease (laparoscopy, robotic surgery, vaginal surgery)

study_pop.textblock: Patients with chronic pelvic pain and a benign gynecologic disease associated, referring to Gynecologic Unit of University Hospital of Modena, who underwent minimally invasive surgery from 2010 to 2019

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Underwent Minimally invasive gynecologic surgery from 2010 to 2019
- Chronic pelvic pain
- Benign gynecologic disease (Endometriosis, myoma, adenomyosis, pelvic organ prolapse
Exclusion Criteria:
- malignant gynecologic disease
- chronic pelvic pain not linked to gynecologic disease

responsible_party.investigator_title: Dr. Carlo Alboni MD, PhD Head of Minimally Invasive and Robotic Gynecologic Surgery Unit University Hospital of Modena - Italy

patient_data.ipd_description: I prefer to not share individual participant data
